turns.content: Has Cray collaborated with any companies or research institutions outside of the United States? If so, can you provide examples?

Yes, Cray has collaborated with several companies and research institutions outside the United States. Below are some examples:

1. Partnership with Swiss National Supercomputing Centre: In 2014, Cray partnered with Swiss National Supercomputing Centre (CSCS) to deliver a new XC supercomputer. This collaboration aimed to provide researchers with increased computing power and speed.

2. Collaboration with Met Office in the UK: Cray collaborated with the UK’s Met Office to develop new models of weather prediction. This partnership aimed to improve the accuracy of weather forecasting in the UK.

3. Collaboration with Japan’s National Institute of Advanced Industrial Science and Technology: In 2019, Cray partnered with Japan’s National Institute of Advanced Industrial Science and Technology (AIST) to deliver a new supercomputer. 4. Collaboration with University of Stuttgart in Germany: Cray collaborated with the University of Stuttgart in Germany to deliver a new supercomputer in 2017. This collaboration aimed to advance research in fields such as materials science and engineering.

It's worth noting that Cray has delivered many other supercomputers to institutions outside of the United States, and that their peak performance can fluctuate depending on various factors.
